yoruba: Ojú kì í pọ́n baálé ilé kó fọwọ́ gbálẹ̀ ilé ẹ̀.
gold: A head of a household is never so hard up that he sweeps his compound with his bare hands.
gen: The Yoruba proverb "Ojú kì í pọ́n baálé ilé kó fọwọ́ gbálẹ̀ ilé ẹ̀" translates to English as "The head of a household does not become so blind that he uses his hands to feel his way around his own house." This proverb suggests that a person in a position of authority or familiarity should not become so incapacitated or unaware that they cannot manage their own responsibilities or environment.
